description: From Late Latin martyrium (also 'martyrdom'), from Ancient Greek (martyrion), from (martys) 'witness'.

entries.meaning: A shrine in honor of a (usually religious, notably Christian) martyr, possibly at his grave.
examples: Major martyries are often traditional destinations of pilgrimages, hence become chapels or churches beyond the local parish needs

entries.meaning: A shrine at a site which "bears witness" to a crucial religious event not related to a tomb.
